author: henning
msg: - factored out the code that is necessary to open a PropertyStream
- changed the EOF logic from throwing a NullPointerException (and later
catch it) to actually check for the null value from the reader and
- moved to StringUtils.split() from the check for the "=" sign
- clean up split logic to use "continue" and "break" to escape and
continue in the property reading loop and the PropertyReader
- Allow derived classes to lock including (when the created object has
no backing file or resource and include has no real meaning)

author: henning
msg: - Updated Version to 1.0-dev-2, because we do incompatible changes to 1.0-dev
and I try to avoid a "commons-lang" desaster. :-)
- cleaned up the autogenerated properties in build.xml a bit
- updated the jar versions required for building to the current versions

author: henning
msg: Fix up the test case for the PropertiesConfiguration to actually work. :-)
Move the tested properties file from the test source tree into a conf
commons-configuration should now build under maven and ant (gump).

author: henning
msg: Ignore the result of the TestPropertiesConfiguration and the

author: henning
msg: Make commons-configuration buildable on JDKs that don't include xerces
and xml-apis (e.g. JDK 1.3.x). Add missing dependencies.
